repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Emergency Farm
            Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Farm
            Reconstruction Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, project sustainability
            was uncertain, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the design of an emergency reconstruction
            project should be simple and such that implementation can be
            accomplished quickly and benefits generated without an undue
            gestation period, as was the case with this project.
            Provision should be made for engaging technical assistance
            as needed from preparation through the first year of
            implementation. Even under pressures of an emergency, it is
            preferable to carefully canvass the beneficiaries concerning
            their specific needs and preferences and procure goods and
            services that match these as closely as possible. Where
            required accompanying measures, such as extension advice,
            inputs, operating credit or marketing assistance, cannot be
            included, which is often the case with emergency projects,
            efforts should be made as soon as possible to have such
            measures provided by the borrower or included in
            supplementary operations financed by the Bank or other agencies.

docna.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Emergency Farm
            Reconstruction Project

display_title.display_title:
Bosnia and Herzegovina -
            Emergency Farm Reconstruction Project

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Emergency Farm
            Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Emergency Farm
            Reconstruction Project are to jump-start agricultural
            production, improve food security, and create employment and
            income for the war-affected rural population including
            returning displaced persons. The project comprises the
            following components: (a) farm mechanization will provide
            motor-cultivators and tractors, replacement of lost
            tractors, replacement of selected combine harvesters, and
            provision of related technical assistance and training; (b)
            livestock production will assist in rebuilding the national
            herds for milk and meat production, through the import of
            cattle, goats and sheep; (c) animal health services will
            help strengthen veterinary services by equipping and
            rebuilding private veterinary stations, and provide
            equipment; and (d) project implementation will assist with
            start-up and will implement the project through provision of
            equipment, technical assistance, training and studies, and
            through financing of incremental recurrent expenditures.

docna.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Emergency Farm
            Reconstruction Project

display_title.display_title:
Bosnia and Herzegovina -
            Emergency Farm Reconstruction Project
